learning_outcomes.description: Apply reflective practice to identify goals and self-evaluate progress in ongoing resilience and professional development, appropriately selecting and utilising healthcare evidence and feedback to ensure capability for practice in multiple settings.

As a developing student, act with initiative and judgement in planning, problem solving and decision making in an interprofessional practice setting, adhering to requirements defined by Nursing and Midwifery Board of Australia's Professional Standards.
Utilise effective communication skills to make a clear and coherent presentation of knowledge and ideas with intellectual independence.

Commence to effectively plan, implement and evaluate midwifery care that respects and acknowledges the values of women, neonates and their families of different cultures and backgrounds, while maintaining the principles of confidentiality.
Demonstrate and consolidate effective time management, clinical reasoning, and professional judgement to deliver woman centred care, that can be utilised in global environments.

assessments.assessment_title: START and Development of Clinical Placement
assessments.due_date: MedSafe calculation certificates by week 1 of placement and all required Midwifery Clinical Skills and mid-point AMSAT need to be submitted half-way through the placement hours.
assessments.task_description: This assessment comprises three (3) parts and requires the student to undertake: online assessment on medication drug calculations; complete midwifery clinical skills and a Mid-point AMSAT. Please see Blackboard for details.
assessments.submission_guidelines: MedSafe certificate submitted to the companion Blackboard site under Assessments. All MPEs, CoCEs and AMSAT to be submitted to ePAD and verified by a registered practitioner.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date: All required Midwifery Clinical Skills and final AMSAT, including MPEs, CoCEs and hours need to be submitted by the completion of clinical placement.
assessments.task_description: This assessment comprises three (3) parts and requires the student to complete midwifery clinical skills; required MPEs and CoCEs and Final AMSAT. Please see Blackboard for details.
assessments.submission_guidelines: All required Learning Goals, MPE's, CoCE's and AMSATs need to be submitted to ePAD and verified by a registered practitioner.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Exam - during Exam Period (School ): Midwifery OSCE
assessments.due_date:
End of Semester Exam Period

2/11/2024 - 16/11/2024

Students will be allocated a time during the Examination period.
assessments.category: Examination, Practical/ Demonstration, Role play/ Simulation
assessments.task_description:
This practical exam will require the student to demonstrate, theoretical knowledge, clinical confidence and competence in demonstration of skills chosen from the course content of MIDW2109. 

  • This examination will be conducted in a simulated environment and will consist of one case which will require performance of three [3] different clinical skills, following skills performance students will be asked three [3] questions regarding underpinning theory content knowledge of the skill. For each of the three [3] skills assessed students will be marked against the quality of a performance grid based on the AMSAT.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
MIDW2109 Clinical Practice 4a

Clinical practice attendance at allocated hospital/location. Completion of all clinical practice shifts (160hrs) is compulsory.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
